headline: $11 Billion Deal, A Billion-Dollar Blow, and a Death at Sea -- The HPE-Autonomy Saga Isn't Over Yet
summary: A decade-long fraud case ends with a $985M ruling, a sunken yacht, and the tech tycoon's estate still on the hook.

raw.headline: $11 Billion Deal, A Billion-Dollar Blow, and a Death at Sea -- The HPE-Autonomy Saga Isn't Over Yet

headline: UK court awards £700 mn to HP in late tycoon's fraud case
summary: A UK court Tuesday awarded £700 million ($946 million) compensation to IT firm Hewlett Packard in a fraud case involving late British tech tycoon Mike Lynch, killed last year when his superyacht sank off Sicily.The British court had not yet awarded damages when Lynch was killed along with his 18-year-old daughter Hannah, four friends and the yacht's cook in the sinking of his British-flagged vessel Bayesian in a storm in August 2024.

headline: Unstructured Data Growth and Hybrid Cloud Adoption Drive Record-High LTO Tape Capacity Shipments in 2024
summary: SILICON VALLEY, Calif., July 22, 2025--The report reveals a record 176.5 Exabytes (EB) of total tape capacity (compressed) shipped in 2024, representing a growth of 15.4% over 2023.

headline: UK court says HPE owed more than $940 million in fraud case against late tech tycoon Mike Lynch
summary: Hewlett Packard is owed more than 700 million pounds ($943 million) from British tech tycoon Mike Lynch's estate and his former finance director after they lost a fraud case involving Lynch's software company, a U.K. High Court judge ruled on Tuesday.  The U.S. tech company, now known as Hewlett-Packard Enterprise, had accused Lynch of fraud and conspiracy after it bought Lynch's company, Autonomy Corp., for $11 billion.  HPE also took Lynch to court in the U.K., seeking up to $4 billion in damages in a civil case.

The U.S. tech company, now known as Hewlett-Packard Enterprise, had accused Lynch of fraud and conspiracy after it bought Lynch's company, Autonomy Corp., for $11 billion.  HPE also took Lynch to court in the U.K., seeking up to $4 billion in damages in a civil case.
